newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia raises 1997 selloff target to 10 trln rbls.
newsitem.headline: Russia raises 1997 selloff target to 10 trln rbls.

text.p: Russian economic policy chief Anatoly Chubais has raised the government's 1997 target for revenue from privatisation to 10 trillion roubles ($1.7 billion) from 6.53 trillion, privatisation minister Alfred Kokh said on Thursday.

"Today Chubais told the cabinet that the sum of privatisation revenues must be raised significantly to at least 10 trillion roubles," Kokh, a deputy prime minister and chairman of the State Property Committee, told a news conference.
Chubais, himself a former privatisation chief, took charge of Russian economic policy in a government reshuffle last month. He is one of two first deputy prime ministers in the new government.
Kokh's news conference followed cabinet discussions on Russian privatisation policy.

Russia's main targets for privatisation this year are stakes in state telecoms holding company Svyazinvest, state oil holding company Rosneft, insurer Rosgosstrakh, and national power company Unified Energy System (UES) EESR.RTS.

The government has missed previous targets for privatisation revenues and the communist opposition, the largest party in the State Duma lower house of parliament, accuses it of selling valuable companies off too cheaply.
